title: Haunted Subway Terminal Adventure #29
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Abandoned Subway Platform
rooms.description: A decaying subway platform frozen in time. Flickering fluorescent lights cast eerie shadows across cracked tiles. The air is cold and damp, carrying the smell of rust and decay. Old advertisements from the 1950s peel from the walls. A rusted train car sits motionless on the tracks, and water drips steadily from the ceiling. The ticket booth stands dark and empty.

items.name: abandoned ticket booth
items.description: A small booth with a dusty window and a locked cash drawer

items.name: tarnished brass key
items.description: An old brass key with 'MAINTENANCE' engraved on it

items.name: vintage subway poster
items.description: A faded poster advertising the grand opening of the terminal
items.text: GRAND OPENING 1957! Welcome to Terminal Station - Your Gateway to the City! Station Master: Harold Graves. Remember: In case of emergency, use the tunnel exit located beyond the control room.

items.name: collapsed newspaper stand
items.description: A metal stand with yellowed newspapers scattered around it

items.name: yellowed newspaper
items.description: A newspaper from October 1957
items.text: MYSTERIOUS DISAPPEARANCES AT TERMINAL STATION - October 31, 1957. Station Master Harold Graves reports strange occurrences. 'The combination to the emergency systems is the year we opened,' he stated. Several passengers have vanished without a trace.

items.name: abandoned train car
items.description: A subway car covered in rust and graffiti, doors hanging open

items.name: conductor's logbook
items.description: A water-damaged logbook left on a seat
items.text: Final Entry - October 31, 1957: Something is wrong with this station. Harold Graves has locked himself in the control room. The passengers... they just disappear into the tunnels. If anyone finds this, the control room key is hidden in the maintenance locker.

items.name: metal maintenance locker
items.description: A tall locker with a brass lock and 'AUTHORIZED PERSONNEL ONLY' stenciled on it

items.name: heavy flashlight
items.description: An old metal flashlight that still works

items.name: control room key
items.description: A silver key labeled 'STATION CONTROL'

items.name: broken vending machine
items.description: An ancient vending machine with a cracked glass front

items.name: station layout map
items.description: A laminated map showing the terminal layout
items.text: TERMINAL STATION MAP: Platform Level - Ticket Booth, Maintenance Areas. Upper Level - Control Room (Station Master's Office). Emergency Exit - Located in the tunnels beyond the control room. For emergencies, contact Station Master Harold Graves.

items.name: control room door
items.description: A heavy metal door with a keyhole, leading up stairs to the station control room. A sign reads 'AUTHORIZED PERSONNEL ONLY'

rooms.name: Station Control Room
rooms.description: A cramped office overlooking the platform through grimy windows. Banks of ancient switches and dials line the walls, some still blinking with faint power. The station master's desk is covered with papers and incident reports. A large map of the subway system hangs on one wall. The air is stale and oppressive. A sealed emergency door leads deeper into the tunnels.

items.name: station master's desk
items.description: A cluttered wooden desk with multiple drawers and scattered papers

items.name: incident report
items.description: An official report filed by the station master
items.text: INCIDENT REPORT - Filed by Harold Graves, Station Master. Date: October 31, 1957 (10/31). Multiple passengers reported hearing voices in the tunnels. Emergency protocols activated. The tunnel exit is the only safe way out. Bottom drawer combination is today's date: 1031.

items.name: emergency procedures manual
items.description: A thick binder with emergency protocols
items.text: EMERGENCY EVACUATION PROCEDURES: In case of station emergency, proceed to tunnel exit. Exit requires security verification. Questions: 1) Who is the station master? 2) Where is the emergency exit located? 3) When did this station open?

items.name: main control panel
items.description: A panel with switches, dials, and indicator lights
items.text: TERMINAL STATION CONTROL PANEL - Opened 1957. Station Master: Harold Graves. All emergency systems route through the tunnel exit beyond this room.

items.name: large subway system map
items.description: A detailed map showing all subway lines and stations
items.text: The map shows Terminal Station as a major hub. A red line marks the emergency tunnel exit route. A note reads: 'Emergency exit located in the tunnels - Station Master authorization required.'

items.name: metal filing cabinet
items.description: A dented cabinet with employee records and station documents

items.name: personnel file
items.description: Employment records for station staff
items.text: PERSONNEL RECORDS - Terminal Station, Opened 1957. Station Master: Harold Graves (Chief Officer). Conductors: Multiple. Maintenance: Various. Note: Station Master Graves has sole authority over emergency tunnel access.

items.name: station master's logbook
items.description: A leather-bound book with daily entries
items.text: Final Entry - Harold Graves, October 31, 1957: I don't know what's happening. The tunnels... something is down there. I've sealed the emergency exit with security questions. Only someone who understands this station's history can escape. God help us all.

items.name: emergency tunnel door
items.description: A reinforced steel door with a security panel displaying three verification questions. Warning lights flash red around the frame.

password_questions.question: Who is the station master?
password_questions.hint: Check the incident reports, personnel files, and the opening poster

password_questions.question: Where is the emergency exit located?
password_questions.hint: The emergency manual and station map mention this location

password_questions.question: When did this station open?
password_questions.hint: The opening poster and multiple documents reference the opening year

rooms.name: Emergency Tunnel Exit
rooms.description: You've made it to the emergency exit! A concrete tunnel with emergency lighting leads upward to street level. Fresh air flows down from above, carrying the sounds of the city. Behind you, the haunted terminal fades into darkness. A metal ladder leads up to a manhole cover and freedom. You can see daylight filtering through the grate above.

items.name: metal ladder
items.description: A sturdy ladder leading up to the surface

items.name: illuminated exit sign
items.description: A glowing green sign pointing upward to safety

items.name: emergency telephone
items.description: A red emergency phone mounted on the wall

rooms.win_message: You climb the ladder and push open the manhole cover, emerging onto a city street bathed in sunlight. The sounds of traffic and people fill your ears - the sounds of the living world. You've escaped the Haunted Subway Terminal! As you look back at the manhole, you swear you hear distant whispers echoing from below, but you don't look back. You're free. You win!
